On a player’s turn, they move 1 of their active Guru markers (Note: Active Guru markers are the ones remaining on the board) according to the Action card; they then replace the card they used with the 3rd card. The other player then moves accordingly, and exchanges their card with this new 3rd card - the card the first player just used.
Moving a marker on top of one of an opponent player’s markers removes that opponent’s marker from the game.

A player may stack a maximum of 2 of their pieces on any space except the center space. A stack prevents either stacked piece from being captured.

Moving your active Guru markers to the home row spaces of 
your opponent wins you the game.

As long as one of a player’s markers remains on the center space on the board, that player may, during their turn, flip their Action card over to its opposite face to introduce a new move into the game.

Action cards should be oriented with the name of the action at the bottom of the card. Each card shows the player’s marker in the middle of the card and indicates which spaces, either forward, backward or to the side, to which they may move their marker. Below this diagram, the action on the other face of the card is displayed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS
Description:
Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS is the master rules set for a new 28mm Monster Skirmish Game. It is based around the Aliens of the HP Lovecraft mythos, and will cover all main 7 species.

The premise is the wars fought on Earth before the rise of mankind. Each core box in the wave will be complimented by a separate campaign book. It is flexible enough to include use for play in eras with man where the Aliens were also present.

The miniatures will start with the Starspawn of Cthulhu, as they engage the Elder Things for domination of the newly formed planet. We want these miniatures for ourselves, so will be sculpting and printing all of the races regardless. So the Mi-Go and the rest are in the pipeline.

Miniatures will include resin masters for collectors, and are done in 28mm for most popular ranges. Additionally they scale nicely for 15mm and 6mm gamers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Siege of the Citadel: Luna PD Expansion
Description:
In this expansion you'll discover arch villain Von Hölle a Bauhaus scientist who was corrupted by the power of the Symmetry and now leads a formidable cult of Heretics determined to bring down humanity from within. Players get a 7th faction - Luna PD and Freelancers to mix and match and you've got great new rules to add even greater challenges!

This expansion for Siege of the Citadel will let you play out early events where the heroes of Luna City first discover the corruption of the Dark Symmetry or you can be fighting the full power of the Dark Apostle Ilian as she vies for control of Luna City whilst the Siege of the Citadel is in full swing.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Ultimate Wilderness Add-On Deck
Description:
Delve into the lush terrain of Golarion to gain new cards for your wild, wild life. Overgrown with new animal allies and fungal infusions, the Ultimate Wilderness Add-On Deck can be used with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game character or Adventure Path. Or you can play with the character included in this 109-card box: Zova, the iconic Shifter!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)

Name: Wicked Apples: Seasonal
Description: The Wicked Apples Seasonal expansion contains 4 new apples (Loved, Sparkling, Zombie and Peppermint) which can swapped out with previous apples from the base game.

Name: Top Deer
Description:
Top Deer is a race game in which 2-4 players try and breed and race the best reindeer for Santa's sleigh team.

The chief stablemaster at Santa's North Pole lair has announced his upcoming retirement, and Santa is holding a contest to decide who to promote. Whoever can win the most races - or most-accurately pick the fastest reindeer most consistently - will get the top job, but there are a number of less-than-nice-list tactics your opponents might employ to bump your career off the track!

Each reindeer is represented by a hand of five regular French-deck playing cards. In each race player stack these cards in a pre-determined order and turn them over to move their reindeer around the track; after each race players have a chance to selectively breed the best traits from their current reindeer into the next generation of racers.

Top Deer is a single-sheet game that doesn't need any construction and just requires a few tokens per player and a couple of decks of cards, intended to be included in a Christmas card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terraforming Mars: BGG User-Created Corporation Pack
Description:
Terraforming Mars: BGG User-Created Corporation Pack is a promo for Terraforming Mars consisting of three corporations created by users of BGG. They were chosen as winners of a contest hosted on BGG, where users submitted over 400 corporation ideas.

The winning corporations included in this pack are:


     Arcadian Communities (designed by TheUbiquitous) 
     Splice Tactical Genomics (designed by Acleveralias)
     Recyclon (designed by Dragonborn110)

Name: Monopoly: Sonic Boom
Description: Monopoly with Sonic the Hedgehog.
Families: Video Game Theme: Sonic the Hedgehog

Name: DUNE: Struggle for Arrakis
Description:
10193 AG – The drug spice melange is the most precious substance in the known universe, enabling humans to achieve great mental feats. It can only be found on the planet Arrakis, commonly referred to as Dune, its profitable harvesting operations administered by the Great House Atreides.

After a treacherous sneak attack by the Padishah Emperor and House Harkonnen, the young Paul Atreides finds refuge with the indigenous Fremen who believe him to be their “Giver of Water”, a messianic off-world prophet destined to lead them out of darkness. The new Duke forms a massive army of Fremen fighters with the aim of fulfilling the prophecy, changing the course of humanity forever.

"DUNE: Struggle for Arrakis" is a two-player Strategic wargame depicting the insurgency known as the Arrakis Revolt. The game builds upon Mark Simonitch's The U.S. Civil War (GMT), adding new twists like changeable terrain, heavy storms and sandworms – all with a simplified ruleset and a more manageable playtime. The game is non-profit and free to download and play.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
